page.title: 10THE ROMAN VILLA,SPARSHOLT.
page.content: The remains of a Roman villa were excavated by Hampshire Field Club in 1965 in West Wood which is part of Crab Wood.Crab Wood is a nature reserve just south of Sparsholt. The most important discovery was a mosaic which is nearly complete.The mosaic is in Winchester Museum.The design consists of a star in the middle surrounded by a key s-shaped pattern and a twisted rope pattern.A square plaited shape surrounds it all. In 1978 the school wanted a badge. While at a service at the church a teacher saw the mosaic design on a kneeler,and altered it for the school.The three sports day teams are named after the shapes on the mosaic. They are Star,Key and Rope.The school sweatshirt and T-shirt have the mosaic design on them.
